answer: Electricity is used in everyday life for a wide range of applications, including transport, heating, lighting, communications, and computation. It is a very convenient way to transfer energy and has been adapted to a huge number of uses. In homes and factories, electricity is used for lighting, replacing the naked flames of gas lighting and reducing fire hazards. Electric power is generally supplied to businesses and homes by the electric power industry, and is usually sold by the kilowatt hour.
